problemStatement.formal: \forall A \subseteq \mathbb{N}, d^*(A) > 0 \implies \exists B,C \text{ infinite}: B+C \subseteq A
problemStatement.plain: Any A ⊆ ℕ of positive upper density contains a sumset B + C where both B and C are infinite.
